terms.title: Terms and conditions
terms.intro: These general terms and conditions apply to all agreements between Caribbean Azure and the client.

article1.title: Article 1 – Definitions
items: Contractor: Caribbean Azure, based in the Netherlands
Client: The natural or legal person entering into an agreement with the contractor
Services: All work performed by the contractor, including automation, web development, AI integrations, consultancy, and training
Deliverable: A concrete delivered product or result such as a workflow, dashboard, website, or report
Blueprint: A visual plan with flowcharts, data flows, and technical specifications

article2.title: Article 2 – Applicability
paragraphs: 2.1. These general terms and conditions apply to all offers, quotations, and agreements between contractor and client.
2.2. Deviations from these terms are only valid if agreed upon in writing.
2.3. The applicability of any purchasing or other terms and conditions of the client is expressly rejected.
2.4. If one or more provisions in these general terms and conditions are void, the remaining provisions remain fully effective.

article3.title: Article 3 – Quotation and formation
paragraphs: 3.1. All quotations are non-binding and valid for 30 days, unless stated otherwise.
3.2. An agreement is concluded after written confirmation by the contractor or upon commencement of work.
3.3. Prices in quotations are exclusive of VAT, unless stated otherwise.
3.4. If the client does not agree with a quotation, it automatically expires after 30 days.

article4.title: Article 4 – Execution of the assignment
paragraphs: 4.1. The contractor will execute the agreement to the best of its ability, in accordance with state-of-the-art practices in the industry.
4.2. Delivered deliverables are tested prior to delivery. The client has 5 working days to provide feedback.
4.3. The client provides all necessary information, access, and cooperation in a timely manner. Delays caused by the client may lead to adjustments in planning and costs.
4.4. The contractor has the right to engage third parties in the execution of the assignment.
4.5. Stated lead times are indicative and not strict deadlines, unless expressly agreed upon in writing.

article5.title: Article 5 – Prices and payment
paragraphs: 5.1. All prices are exclusive of VAT and exclusive of costs for external tools (such as Zapier, Make, API licenses).
5.2. Payment must be made within 14 days after the invoice date, unless otherwise agreed.
5.3. For projects above €5,000, the contractor may send a down payment invoice of 30% upon signing.
5.4. If the payment term is exceeded, the client is in default without further notice. The contractor has the right to charge 1% interest per month.
5.5. All collection costs, both judicial and extrajudicial, are at the expense of the client.

article6.title: Article 6 – Intellectual property
paragraphs: 6.1. All intellectual property rights to works developed or delivered by the contractor rest with the contractor, unless agreed otherwise in writing.
6.2. The client obtains a non-exclusive, non-transferable right of use for the delivered deliverables for internal use within the organization.
6.3. The client is not permitted to reproduce, sell, or make the delivered works available to third parties without prior written permission from the contractor.
6.4. Custom code and scripts remain the property of the contractor, but the client receives full access and modification rights for internal use.
6.5. Reusable components, templates, and frameworks developed by the contractor remain the contractor's property and may be reused for other projects.

article7.title: Article 7 – Liability
paragraphs: 7.1. The contractor is only liable for direct damage resulting from intent or willful recklessness on the part of the contractor.
7.2. Liability for indirect damage, including consequential damage, lost profits, missed savings, and damage due to business interruption, is excluded.
7.3. The contractor's liability is limited to a maximum of the invoice amount for the relevant assignment, with a maximum of €25,000.
7.4. The client is responsible for making backups of their own data and systems. The contractor is not liable for data loss.
7.5. The contractor is not liable for outages, failures, or changes in external systems and APIs of third parties (such as Zapier, Make, ClickUp, Google, Microsoft).

article8.title: Article 8 – Warranty and maintenance
paragraphs: 8.1. The contractor guarantees that delivered deliverables meet the specifications described in the blueprint.
8.2. During the agreed support period (standard 30 days after delivery), the contractor fixes bugs and functional issues free of charge.
8.3. After the support period expires, bugs and adjustments can be invoiced based on hourly rate or via a support subscription.
8.4. The warranty expires if the client or third parties have made changes to the delivered systems without permission.

article9.title: Article 9 – Confidentiality
paragraphs: 9.1. Both parties commit to confidentiality of all confidential information obtained from each other in the context of the agreement.
9.2. The contractor may use the client's name and a general description of the project for reference purposes, unless agreed otherwise in writing.
9.3. At the client's request, a separate Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) can be concluded prior to the quotation phase.

article10.title: Article 10 – Termination and cancellation
paragraphs: 10.1. Both parties can terminate the agreement in writing with a notice period of 30 days, unless otherwise agreed.
10.2. In case of early termination by the client, the client remains obligated to pay for work already performed and costs incurred.
10.3. The contractor has the right to terminate the agreement with immediate effect if the client fails to meet payment obligations or is declared bankrupt.
10.4. For retainer agreements, a notice period of 60 days applies at the end of a calendar month.

article11.title: Article 11 – Applicable law and disputes
paragraphs: 11.1. All agreements between contractor and client are exclusively governed by Dutch law.
11.2. Disputes will be submitted to the competent court in the district where the contractor is located.
11.3. Parties will first attempt to resolve a dispute through mutual consultation before resorting to court.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Caribbean Azure respects your privacy and processes your data in accordance with GDPR. This policy explains what data we collect, why, and how you can exercise your rights.

section1.title: 1. Who is responsible?
section1.text: Caribbean Azure is responsible for processing personal data as described in this privacy policy.

section2.title: 2. What data do we collect?
section2.summary: We only collect data that you actively provide or that is necessary for the website to function.

section3.title: 3. Why do we process your data?
contactItems: To prepare a quote or proposal
To inform you about our services (only if you give permission)
analyticsItems: To understand how visitors use the website
section3.legal: Legal basis: We process your data based on your consent, performance of a contract, or legitimate interest (analytics).

section4.title: 4. How long do we keep your data?
items: Contact forms: 2 years after last contact (unless there is an agreement)
Customer data: 7 years after end of agreement (legal retention requirement)
section4.deletion: After the retention period, we permanently delete your data, unless a legal retention obligation applies.

section5.title: 5. Do we share your data with third parties?
section5.intro: We never sell or rent your data to third parties. We only share data with parties that help us deliver our services:
section5.dpa: We have concluded a data processing agreement with all processors in accordance with GDPR. More details can be found on our /security page.

section6.title: 6. Your rights
section6.intro: You have the following rights under GDPR:
rights: Right of access: You may request what data we have about you
Right to rectification: You can have incorrect data corrected
Right to erasure: You can request deletion of your data
Right to restriction: You can request to limit processing
Right to data portability: You can request your data in a structured format
Right to object: You can object to processing
Right to withdraw consent: If we work based on consent
section6.exercise: To exercise your rights, send an email to privacy@caribbeanazure.com. We respond within 30 days.
section6.complaint: Don't agree with how we process your data? You can file a complaint with the Dutch Data Protection Authority.

section7.title: 7. Security
section7.intro: We take security seriously and implement appropriate technical and organizational measures:
measures: HTTPS/TLS encryption for all data in transit
Access control and authorization (Role-Based Access Control)
Data is encrypted at rest where possible
Logging and monitoring of system activity
section7.moreInfo: More details about our security measures can be found on the /security page.

section8.title: 8. Cookies and tracking
section8.intro: This website uses cookies. You can adjust your preferences via the cookie banner that appears on your first visit, or via the settings at the bottom of this page.
section8.noTracking: We do not use Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, or other invasive tracking tools.

section9.title: 9. Changes
section9.text1: We may update this privacy policy. The most recent version can always be found on this page. The date of the last change is at the top of this document.
section9.text2: For major changes, we will inform you via email (if we have your email address).

section10.title: 10. Contact
section10.intro: Do you have questions about this privacy policy or want to exercise your rights?
section10.details:

Correspondence address: Caribbean Azure, Netherlands
